- May 27, 2024 Leading the Way: Innovations at Texas Infusion Centers guest_deadline - May 27, 2024 Unifying the Blockchain Universe: The Transformative Power of Crypto Bridges Collaborative Post In the rapidly evolving world of blockchain technology, one of the most significant challenges has been the fragmentation of ecosystems. With numerous blockchain networks operating in isolation, each with its own unique features and strengths, the potential for collaboration and innovation has been limited. However, a groundbreaking solution has emerged in the form of crypto bridges, which promise to tear down the walls separating these disparate systems and usher in a new era of interoperability and cross-chain transactions. At their core, crypto bridges are protocols or platforms that enable the seamless transfer of digital assets, such as cryptocurrencies, tokens, or non-fungible tokens (NFTs), across different blockchain networks. These bridges act as intermediaries, facilitating the movement of value between otherwise incompatible ecosystems, unlocking a world of possibilities for developers, users, and the decentralized finance (DeFi) industry as a whole. The Growing Need for Interoperability As the adoption of blockchain technology continues to accelerate, the need for interoperability has become increasingly apparent. Each blockchain network offers its own unique features, such as scalability, security, privacy, or specialized functionality, catering to diverse use cases and requirements. However, the inability to transfer assets or communicate across these networks has created siloes, hindering the potential for collaboration, liquidity, and innovation. Photo by Art Rachen on Unsplash Imagine a scenario where a user holds Ether (ETH) on the Ethereum network but wants to participate in a lending protocol built on the Binance Smart Chain (BSC). Without a crypto bridge, the user would be forced to sell their ETH, incurring transaction fees and potentially missing out on opportunities. Alternatively, they might have to maintain separate wallets and manage multiple cryptocurrencies, adding complexity and friction to the experience. Crypto bridges like Defi Way solve this problem by enabling the seamless transfer of assets between different blockchain networks, effectively breaking down the barriers that have traditionally existed between these ecosystems. The Mechanics Behind Crypto Bridges At the heart of crypto bridges lies a process known as “wrapping” or “tokenization.” This involves locking the original asset on the source blockchain and minting a corresponding token on the destination blockchain. This wrapped token represents the locked asset and can be used within the destination blockchain’s ecosystem as if it were the original asset. For example, if a user wants to transfer Ether (ETH) from the Ethereum network to the Binance Smart Chain (BSC), they can use a crypto bridge to “wrap” their ETH into a tokenized version, such as Wrapped ETH (WETH), that is compatible with the BSC network. This WETH can then be used seamlessly within the BSC ecosystem, allowing the user to participate in decentralized applications (dApps), lending protocols, or liquidity pools on that network. The process of unwrapping the asset involves burning the wrapped token on the destination blockchain and unlocking the original asset on the source blockchain, ensuring the conservation of value and maintaining the integrity of the underlying assets. Trusted and Trustless Crypto Bridges Crypto bridges can be classified into two main categories: trusted bridges and trustless bridges. 1. Trusted Bridges: Trusted bridges rely on a centralized or semi-centralized entity, such as a custodian or a federation of validators, to facilitate the wrapping and unwrapping of assets between blockchains. These bridges require users to trust the custodian or federation to accurately represent the locked assets on the destination blockchain. While trusted bridges offer a more streamlined user experience, they introduce a degree of centralization and counterparty risk. 2. Trustless Bridges: In contrast, trustless bridges operate in a decentralized and trustless manner, leveraging smart contracts and cryptographic techniques to enable cross-chain asset transfers without relying on a central authority. These bridges employ mechanisms like atomic swaps, hash time-locked contracts (HTLCs), or more advanced techniques like zk-rollups or optimistic rollups to ensure the security and integrity of the bridged assets. Trustless bridges are generally considered more secure and align better with the decentralized ethos of blockchain technology, but they can be more complex to implement and may have higher transaction costs. Unlocking Opportunities with Crypto Bridges The emergence of crypto bridges has unlocked numerous opportunities and benefits for the blockchain ecosystem, including: 1. Enhanced Liquidity and Capital Efficiency: By enabling the seamless transfer of assets across networks, crypto bridges allow users to tap into liquidity pools and opportunities across multiple blockchains. This increased liquidity and capital efficiency can lead to better pricing, reduced slippage, and more efficient allocation of resources within the DeFi ecosystem. 2. Fostering Collaboration and Innovation: With the ability to move assets across different blockchain networks, developers can leverage the strengths and capabilities of various ecosystems to build more complex and innovative decentralized applications (dApps). This cross-chain collaboration fosters creativity and drives the development of groundbreaking solutions. 3. Improved User Experience: Crypto bridges simplify the process of participating in various blockchain ecosystems, eliminating the need for users to manage multiple wallets and constantly swap between different cryptocurrencies. This streamlined experience can drive greater adoption and accessibility for decentralized applications and services. 4. Diversification and Risk Management: By enabling the transfer of assets across multiple networks, crypto bridges allow users to diversify their holdings and exposure, mitigating the risks associated with being tied to a single ecosystem. This diversification can help users manage their investment portfolios more effectively and hedge against potential risks or volatility in specific networks. Challenges and Considerations While crypto bridges offer significant advantages, they also present certain challenges and considerations that must be addressed: 1. Security Risks: As with any blockchain-based system, security is a paramount concern. Crypto bridges can be potential attack vectors for hackers, as they represent centralized points of failure or vulnerabilities in smart contracts. Rigorous auditing, robust security measures, and ongoing monitoring are crucial to mitigate these risks. 2. Regulatory Uncertainty: The regulatory landscape surrounding crypto bridges and cross-chain asset transfers is still evolving. Varying jurisdictions may have different requirements or restrictions, which could impact the adoption and utilization of these bridges. 3. Scalability and Throughput: As the demand for cross-chain transactions grows, crypto bridges may face scalability challenges, particularly in terms of throughput and transaction processing speed. Ongoing improvements and innovations in blockchain technology will be necessary to address these scalability concerns. 4. Compatibility and Standardization: With multiple blockchain networks and varying protocols, ensuring compatibility and adhering to standards can be challenging for crypto bridge developers. Collaborative efforts and industry-wide standards could help streamline the development and adoption of interoperable solutions. The Future of Crypto Bridges and Blockchain Interoperability As the blockchain ecosystem continues to evolve and mature, the role of crypto bridges is poised to become increasingly pivotal. With the growing adoption of decentralized finance (DeFi) and the emergence of new blockchain networks and Layer 2 solutions, the need for seamless cross-chain communication and asset transfer will only intensify. Looking ahead, we can expect to see further advancements in crypto bridge technology, with a focus on improving security, scalability, and user experience. Additionally, the development of more robust and standardized protocols for cross-chain communication could pave the way for broader adoption and integration of crypto bridges across various blockchain ecosystems. Moreover, as regulatory frameworks around cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology evolve, we may see clearer guidelines and policies surrounding the operation and governance of crypto bridges, fostering greater transparency and accountability within the industry. Conclusion Crypto bridges represent a transformative innovation in the blockchain space, enabling seamless cross-chain transactions and fostering interoperability between disparate networks. By breaking down siloes and facilitating the flow of value across ecosystems, these bridges unlock new opportunities for decentralized finance, enhance liquidity and capital efficiency, and drive greater adoption of decentralized applications and services. While challenges remain, particularly in terms of security, scalability, and regulatory uncertainty, the potential benefits of crypto bridges are undeniable. As the blockchain ecosystem continues to evolve, these bridges will play a crucial role in shaping the future of decentralized finance and unlocking the full potential of a truly interconnected and interoperable blockchain landscape. The advent of crypto bridges is a testament to the innovative spirit and collaborative efforts within the blockchain community. By unifying the blockchain universe, these bridges pave the way for a future where seamless cross-chain transactions and interoperability are the norm, ushering in a new era of decentralized innovation and empowering individuals and businesses alike to harness the full potential of this groundbreaking technology. title: Four Seasons Hotel Tianjin’s Aria On 9: A new Standard In Outdoor Dining And Entertainment
description: Four Seasons Hotel Tianjin unveils Aria on 9 Sky Garden, offering panoramic views, exquisite flavors, and a chic, relaxing ambiance for an unparalleled outdoor experience.The post Four Seasons Hotel Tianjin’s Aria On 9: A new Standard In Outdoor Dining And Entertainment appeared first on Travel And Tour World.
content: Tuesday, May 28, 2024 Four Seasons Hotel Tianjin unveils Aria on 9 Sky Garden, offering panoramic views, exquisite flavors, and a chic, relaxing ambiance for an unparalleled outdoor experience. As summer blooms with vibrant energy, it’s the ideal season to explore an outdoor terrace that boasts panoramic city views and delicious dining, providing a snug retreat close to nature. Situated on the ninth level of the Four Seasons Hotel Tianjin, Aria on 9 Sky Garden merges aesthetic design and a lifestyle vibe with breathtaking cityscapes at the city’s core. The area features elegantly designed furniture and a shimmering pool reflection, crafting a contemporary, chic, and tranquil setting. The menu’s delightful tastes and attentive service ensure a standout al fresco experience for visitors. Aria on 9 is now open, offering an urban sanctuary where guests can enjoy captivating moments. Recently, the venue celebrated the launch of its “Sunset Avenue” themed event, offering guests the chance to savor sparkling wines, handcrafted cocktails, and light bites on a beautifully decorated terrace with lively orange decorations. The event was amplified by a vibrant musical backdrop provided by a DJ and international bands, enhancing the summer atmosphere. Aria on 9 introduces a bistro-style menu featuring a selection of cocktails, wines, and whiskies, each paired meticulously with appealing appetizers. Live bands add to the energetic ambiance. The venue will remain open until October, operating from Tuesday to Sunday, from 6 pm to midnight, weather permitting. Each cocktail at Aria on 9, like the Narcissus, blends gin, vodka, rum, and pisco with passion fruit and grapefruit, offering a refreshing and bold taste that reflects the enigmatic charm of its mythological namesake. The venue also boasts a compelling food menu designed to augment the drinks. Highlights include succulent Spanish Garlic Shrimp and indulgent Deep-Fried Risotto Balls wrapped in Parma Ham, each dish providing a unique flavor surprise. Guests can enjoy the Tipsy Set, which includes selected cocktails or house wine with a snack, starting at CNY 314 +15%, available until June 30, 2024, with prior reservation needed. Aria on 9 also serves as a perfect spot for hosting corporate events, weddings, marriage proposals, baby showers, or birthday parties, requiring bookings at least two weeks in advance. For more information, guests can reach out to the Four Seasons Hotel Tianjin at +86 (022) 2716 6688.

title: Emmerdale fans threaten to switch off ITV soap as Tom King scenes 'go too far'
creator: web.help@express.co.uk (Jasmine Allday, Lauren Fletcher)
description: Emmerdale viewers were left fuming after a vile Tom King scene, as they claimed the soap had gone too far - and threatened to switch off after a devastating death
content: viewers were left absolutely horrified and threatening to turn off their TVs after the soap aired some particularly disturbing scenes involving Tom King. Tom has been deceiving everyone into believing that Belle Dingle is the manipulative one in their relationship, but in a shocking twist, it's actually Tom who's been pulling the strings. He's been systematically gaslighting Belle, making her believe she's the one at fault, when in reality, he's the mastermind of manipulation since they tied the knot. In an episode on Monday, 27 May, Belle wrongly blamed herself for their issues, claiming Tom had always treated her with love, Tom grew agitated by her refusal to communicate with him. Desperate to maintain his grip on her, he sought out new ways to exert his control, even when she wasn't physically present. The climax of the episode was too much for many fans to bear as Tom menacingly picked up a syringe and approached their beloved dog Piper, implying he would harm the innocent animal. Viewers were appalled by the scene and quickly expressed their outrage on Twitter. One upset fan tweeted: "Blimey even a dog isn't safe in that f***ing village # ," while another exclaimed: "no f***ing way is he gonna kill that dog #Emmerdale.", reports . A third chimed in with: "NO NOT THE DOG #emmerdale," and a fourth commented: "No! this is too far poor piper leave her alone #Emmerdale." Another added: "this story line is disturbing," and yet another viewer said: "Oh COME ON NOW. This is beyond sick." Emmerdale's recent episodes have taken a dark turn, revealing the harrowing truth of Belle Dingle's (played by Eden Taylor-Draper) life with Tom, as viewers witnessed the chilling moment he discovered her lie about contraception and punished her by scalding her hand under hot water. Eden Taylor-Draper, who brings Belle to life on screen, spoke out about the intense scenes, cautioning fans: "I think you can expect to see everything escalate throughout the episode. You'll see how easily Tom can switch on and off and how he truly feels and his anger towards Belle. You'll get a glimpse into Belle's terrifying reality." The actress also discussed the storyline's significance in shedding light on such a traumatic issue, saying: "People have reached out which I think is a great sign that everything is resonating in some way." She continued, expressing gratitude for the opportunity to portray this narrative: "So many people go through this and I'm really grateful that I've been able to play out Belle's story. We've worked with charities and people that have gone through this and it's important that what we're portraying is real."

title: ECI failed to act like an umpire, accuses Sajjala
creator: M Srinivas
content: YSRCP general secretary Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy on Tuesday accused the Election Commission of India (ECI) of not behaving like an umpire during elections conducted in Andhra Pradesh on May 13. The attitude of the ECI changed after the formation of an alliance comprising BJP, TDP and Jana Sena to contest elections against YSRCP, he said, interacting with media persons. He sought to know why ECI wanted to behave in a “repressive” manner against YSRCP instead of acting as an umpire. Alleging that the ECI was infected with a virus called “Chandrababu,” Reddy said a conspiracy was being hatched to remove Andhra Pradesh Chief Secretary KS Jawahar Reddy. He asked why the TDP was not asking for re-polling in some polling booths when most people were demanding it.

title: Man City captain Walker: I wanted to be a centre-forward
creator: Paul Vegas, Tribal Football
description: Manchester City captain Kyle Walker admits he never began his career as a fullback. For many, Walker is now the best fullback City have seen. But he told the club's website of his time as a junior with Sheffield United: I don't know a right-back or a full-back who started off there.
content: Manchester City captain Kyle Walker admits he never began his career as a fullback. For many, Walker is now the best fullback City have seen. But he told the club's website of his time as a junior with Sheffield United: I don't know a right-back or a full-back who started off there. I couldn't get a game at centre-forward to be completely honest. I signed my scholarship and there were better centre-forwards than me, even though I went to Lilleshall as a centre-forward at Under-16s. I was a late developer. I didn't grow and I was very light. We played Nottingham Forest and they had a quick winger, but the right-back at the time wasn't playing for one reason or another. The coach put me there and from that day on I have never played another position. At first, I thought why am I not playing centre-forward? Why am I not getting the goals and the glory? But you soon realise it's quite enjoyable. Your role changes in the team and I enjoyed setting people up rather than scoring. I went from getting the odd 10 or 15 minutes in the first four months after I came out of school and into full-time football, to playing every game." This article first appeared on Tribal Football and was syndicated with permission.

title: Chinese and Ukrainian astronomers collaborate to protect Earth from asteroids; read on to find out more
description: A collaborative research team from China and Ukraine has made significant strides in tracking near-Earth asteroids (NEAs), improving our ability to assess potential risks.
content: A collaborative research team from China and Ukraine has made significant strides in tracking near-Earth asteroids (NEAs), improving our ability to assess potential risks. By conducting regular observations, the team has been able to pinpoint the locations of these asteroids and accurately map their orbits. NEAs are asteroids whose orbits come close to Earth's, posing a potential threat of collision. The necessity for immediate follow-up observations of newly identified NEAs is crucial for quickly determining their orbital elements. Accurate tracking of these rapidly moving objects requires short exposure times during astronomical measurements to prevent elongated streaks in images. Researchers from the Shanghai Astronomical Observatory (SHAO) under the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the Mykolaiv Astronomical Observatory have developed an innovative technique to address this challenge. The rotating-drift-scan (RDS) charge-coupled device (CCD) technique allows asteroids to be imaged as point sources, even with long exposure times. This advancement is crucial for improving the precision of asteroid tracking . The research leveraged a comprehensive dataset of over 11,000 positional measurements of nearly 500 NEAs. These measurements were captured using two 50-centimetre telescopes located in Xi'an, China, from 2019 to 2023, and in Mykolaiv, Ukraine, from 2011 to 2022. This extensive data collection has been instrumental in refining the tracking and mapping of NEA orbits. A new study published in the Astronomical Journal highlights the potential of this research to revolutionise asteroid detection. By using a network of small telescopes and employing the RDS CCD technique, global monitoring of NEAs can be significantly enhanced. This improvement in detection capabilities is a critical step in protecting Earth from potential asteroid impacts. | Why solar storms impact power grids and when will a solar storm hit Earth next?

title: Nasa's Magellan data indicates volcanic activity on Venus
description: Nasa's Magellan data indicates volcanic activity on Venus
content: NEW DELHI: A recent analysis of data collected by Nasa's Magellan spacecraft between 1990 and 1992 reveals evidence of fresh lava flows on the planet's surface during the spacecraft's observations. The study was published in Nature Astronomy on May 27. Planetary scientist Paul Byrne of Washington University in St Louis, who was not involved in the study said, "This definitely is another step in the path to understanding Venus as a living, breathing world." Despite being similar in size to Earth, Venus was long considered geologically inactive. However, many scientists believed that Venus should have comparable levels of internal heat, which is the primary driver of volcanic activity and earthquakes. The new research follows a similar approach to a study published last year, which identified a volcanic vent changing shape and potentially releasing lava in Magellan data, providing the first conclusive evidence of such activity on Venus. The current study, led by planetary scientist David Sulcanese of D'Annunzio University in Chieti-Pescara, Italy, and his colleagues, searched for signs of volcanism across Venus' vast surface area, which is three times the size of Earth's dry land. Magellan's radar images revealed long, sinuous features appearing between two of the spacecraft's passes over the western slopes of Sif Mons, a large shield volcano, and Niobe Planitia, a flat region dotted with volcanic vents. The researchers considered various explanations for these features, such as artifacts in the radar data or the result of landslides. However, the features followed the local topography, indicating that they were indeed flowing across Venus' surface, and they occurred in relatively flat areas where landslides would be unlikely. Byrne believes that the study authors have convincingly demonstrated that the changes in the surface appearance in these two instances are best explained by the presence of lava flows. He suggests that there may be many more instances of active volcanism waiting to be discovered, given the low resolution of Magellan's data and the immense land area of Venus. Both Byrne and the study authors agree that Venus could currently have a level of volcanic activity comparable to that of Earth. Future NASA missions, such as DAVINCI and VERITAS, scheduled to launch next decade, will provide more detailed maps of the Venusian surface, making it easier to identify signs of ongoing volcanic activity.

title: Political fallout from Israel’s deadly attack on Rafah refugees camp
keywords: from israel's deadly attack on rafah refugee camp
creator: Fidel Rahmati
description: Israel’s deadly attack on a refugee camp in southern Gaza, which reportedly resulted in 45 deaths and 249 injuries, has sparked widespread international reactions. The Israeli Prime Minister called it a “tragic mistake,” while the country’s Foreign Ministry warned its embassies about a “strong wave of anti-Semitism.” The Palestinian Health Ministry reported that the Israeli [...]The post Political fallout from Israel’s deadly attack on Rafah refugees camp appeared first on Khaama Press.
content: Israel’s deadly attack on a refugee camp in southern Gaza, which reportedly resulted in 45 deaths and 249 injuries, has sparked widespread international reactions. The Israeli Prime Minister called it a “tragic mistake,” while the country’s Foreign Ministry warned its embassies about a “strong wave of anti-Semitism.” The Palestinian Health Ministry reported that the Israeli airstrike on a refugee camp in southern Gaza killed at least 45 civilians, including 23 women, children, and elderly people, and injured 249 other civilians. This attack has led to widespread reactions. In response to the global backlash, Benjamin Netanyahu said, “Unfortunately, something tragically went wrong.” The European Union’s foreign policy chief expressed his shock upon hearing the news in his initial reaction. Meanwhile, Axios, citing an American official, reported that the White House is investigating the incident to determine what exactly happened and whether the situation necessitates U.S. action. The identities of the American officials who spoke with Axios are unknown, but the media outlet quoted them saying, “The devastating images following the Israeli military’s Sunday night attack in Rafah... are heartbreaking.” The French President, in a relatively cautious reaction, said that Israel must immediately halt its military operations in Gaza. The Spanish Foreign Minister also stated, “If Israel continues to violate the International Court of Justice’s ruling on stopping the attack on Rafah, we will seek appropriate measures to enforce this decision.” This comes as the Israeli government, led by Netanyahu, faces opposition within Israel for its relentless attacks in Gaza. Netanyahu’s speech in the Israeli parliament was repeatedly interrupted yesterday due to protests. Countries in the region, especially Arab nations, have also reacted to Israel’s attack on the refugee camp in Rafah, calling for an immediate cessation of Israeli military operations in Gaza. In a rare reaction, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan accused Israel of “terrorism.” Save my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment. Δ

title: Michigan mom killed protecting daughter from out-of-control vehicle at drag race
creator: Nika Shakhnazarova
description: The 33-year-old managed to push her daughter out of harm's way just seconds before she was fatally struck by a 1980 Jeep CJ.
content: A Michigan mom was fatally struck by an out-of-control vehicle while heroically saving her two-year-old daughter’s life at a drag racing event on Sunday. Kadie Price, 33, was in the crowd with her family when a 1980 Jeep CJ lost control and veered off the racing strip before slamming into another vehicle, police said. The other vehicle, which had been stationary at the time of impact, struck Price as a result — just seconds after she had pushed her daughter to safety. Chaos ensued at Silver Lake State Park Sand Dunes in western Oceana County — about 270 miles northwest of Detroit, MLive.com reported . Despite several people rushing over to offer immediate care to Price, including Silver Lake State Park rangers, they were ultimately unable to save her. Price was pronounced dead shortly after she was struck just before midday. Her daughter was able to avoid “serious injury or worse,” police said, as a result of her mom’s quick-thinking. “Please keep the Price family in your prayers,” the Oceana County Sheriff’s Office said in a statement. The driver of the Jeep is being identified as a 64-year-old man who hails from Michigan. His name is not being released at this time as the investigation is ongoing. Two off-roaders who took part in Sunday’s race have since detailed the horrific incident. “I’ve been coming out here a long time,” Bryce Straubel told WOOD . “That was probably one of them most brutal accidents I’ve ever seen.” “It breaks me,” Straubel added. “People are coming out here to have a good time and this mother just lost her life. She pushed her daughter out of the way to save her — it’s just rough to hear. It really is.” The Silver Lake State Park is a 3,000-acre park runs along the shorelines of Lake Michigan. It contained about 2,000 acres of san dunes.

title: 12 dead, several missing as stone quarry collapses in Mizoram amid rains
creator: Mohammed Yousuf
description: Twelve people died, and several others were missing as a stone quarry collapsed in Mizoram's Aizawl district on Tuesday morning amid incessant rains as an impact of cyclone Remal, officials said.
content: Aizawl: Twelve people died, and several others were missing as a stone quarry collapsed in Mizoram’s Aizawl district on Tuesday morning amid incessant rains as an impact of cyclone Remal, officials said. The incident happened around 6 am in an area between Melthum and Hlimen on the southern outskirts of the Aizawl town, they said. “Twelve bodies have been recovered so far, while several others are suspected to be still trapped under the debris,” Aizawl’s Deputy Commissioner Nazuk Kumar told PTI. “We are looking for more bodies. The operations will continue till we clear the entire site,” she added. Director-General of Police (DGP) Anil Shukla told PTI that heavy rains were affecting the rescue operations at the disaster site. He said the rains triggered landslides at several other places in the state and at least two persons have been “swept away”. Among the victims of the stone quarry collapse are a four-year-old boy and a six-year-old girl, another police officer said. “We have also rescued two persons alive from the site,” he said. A landslide swept away a building in Aizawl’s Salem Veng, following which three persons went missing. Search is underway for them, an official said. The state capital has been cut off from the rest of the country due to a landslide on National Highway 6 at Hunthar, officials said. Besides, several intra-state highways have also been disrupted by landslides, they said. Chief Minister Lalduhoma announced Rs 4 lakh ex-gratia for the families of those killed in calamities caused by rains, including the quarry collapse. He handed over cheques of Rs 2 lakh each to the families of the eight Mizo people who died in the quarry collapse and said the remaining amount would be given to them soon. Home Minister K Sapdanga told PTI, “The identities of the four non-tribal people are being verified. If they are permanent residents of Mizoram, they will be given the ex-gratia amount. If they came here temporarily to work, then they will not get any financial support.” Lalduhoma said the government has earmarked Rs 15 crore to tackle disasters triggered by rains, which occurred as an aftereffect of cyclone Remal. Later, Lalduhoma along with Sapdanga, who also handles the Disaster Management and Rehabilitation Department, visited the stone quarry site to take stock of the situation and oversee the orescue operations. Because of the rains, all schools were closed and government employees, except those involved in providing essential services, were asked to work from home. Meanwhile, more than 30 families were shifted to safer places due to unprecedented flooding of the Tlawng river at Sairang village, about 21 km from Aizawl, a senior official said. “Several farms on the bank of the river have been fully submerged by the water. The water level is continuing to rise. However, no casualty has been reported,” he added. In Aizawl town, some cemeteries have also been swept away by landslides, and over 150 graves damaged.

title: Typhoon leaves at least seven people dead and thousands displaced in the Philippines
creator: Star Tribune Staff
description: A typhoon has finally moved away from the Philippines, leaving at least seven people dead, mostly due to floods or toppled trees, and forcing the closures of several seaports, stranding thousands of passengers, officials said Tuesday.
content: MANILA, Philippines — A typhoon has finally moved away from the Philippines, leaving at least seven people dead, mostly due to floods or toppled trees, and forcing the closures of several seaports, stranding thousands of passengers, officials said Tuesday. Typhoon Ewiniar crept by the country's eastern coast late Friday night and lingered over the Philippine islands for several days, before shifting northeastward away from the archipelago. All storm warnings were lifted Tuesday. The typhoon's shift in direction spared the densely populated capital, Manila, from a potentially damaging hit. Ewiniar, locally known as Aghon, was last tracked Tuesday about 450 kilometers (280 miles) east of the northern town of Basco in Batanes province with sustained winds of 130 kph (81 mph) and gusts of up to 160 kph (99 mph), according to government forecasters. At least six villagers drowned in floodwaters or died after being hit by falling trees during the sudden deluge in the hard-hit province of Quezon, provincial police said. In southern Misamis Oriental province, a villager died when a tree fell and struck a motorcycle taxi she was riding on with her sister as they were on their way to school, police said. Many villages were overwhelmed by flash floods. Some low-lying areas were engulfed in up to eight feet (2.4 meters) of water in Lucena, Quezon province's capital city. The flooding was partly due to clogged drainage systems after an extra-hot summer season, Quezon Governor Angelina Tan and other provincial officials said. Tan said many houses, including the governor's residence, were damaged by fierce wind and torrential rains. The typhoon forced her to seek shelter elsewhere while overseeing the distribution of food and other aid to displaced villagers, she said. Before flying to Brunei on Tuesday for a state visit, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said more than 26,700 people were affected by the typhoon, including many who fled to evacuation centers in five provincial regions. Three airports and 29 seaports could not operate normally due to the typhoon while six cities and towns were hit by power outages, he said. More than 4,800 passengers, truck drivers and cargo helpers were stranded at one point due to seaport closures as the typhoon lashed southern and central provinces, the Philippine coast guard said. "Even before the typhoon hit, we've transported relief goods in places near the typhoon's expected path, so they were all ready,'' Marcos said. About 20 typhoons and storms each year batter the Philippine archipelago, which also lies in an Asian region often hit by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, making it one of the world's most disaster-prone countries. In 2013, Typhoon Haiyan, one of the strongest on record, left more than 7,300 people dead or missing, flattened entire villages, swept ships inland and displaced more than 5 million in the central Philippines.

title: Chelsea chief pushing for club to beat Man United to transfer of star with £60m buy-out clause
creator: Mark Brus
description: Chelsea chief Joe Shields is pushing for the club to beat Manchester United to the transfer of Crystal Palace winger Michael Olise in a potential £60million deal, according to Simon Phillips on Substack. The talented young Frenchman has shone at Selhurst Park and clearly seems ready to make the step up to a bigger club, [...]The post Chelsea chief pushing for club to beat Man United to transfer of star with £60m buy-out clause appeared first on CaughtOffside.
content: The talented young Frenchman has shone at Selhurst Park and clearly seems ready to make the step up to a bigger club, with key figures clearly eager for him to make the move to Stamford Bridge. According to Phillips, Shields is driving this and pushing for the Blues to sign Olise, who has a £60m release clause at Palace, and who is also wanted by Man Utd. The report adds that Olise came very close to joining Chelsea last summer, so it could still be that they will be able to lure him to the club this year, in what could be a vital move for the west Londoners to bring in a much-needed upgrade on the likes of Mykhailo Mudryk, Raheem Sterling and Noni Madueke. Olise transfer: Should he choose Chelsea or Man United? Chelsea and United are two of the biggest clubs in England, and indeed Europe, so it might not be the easiest choice for Olise if it comes down to a decision between those two. Still, even if MUFC just won the FA Cup final, there clearly seems to be a more promising project being put together at CFC, especially once they finalise a deal to . The Red Devils are surely at an earlier stage of their project due to the recent change in ownership and new arrivals at board level, so that could likely mean a change of manager in the near future, as well as numerous ins and outs in the transfer market. Olise would do well to take these things into consideration when choosing his next move, though in truth he’ll perhaps be hoping the likes of Arsenal, Manchester City or Liverpool join the race as they’d likely be much better moves for him at this stage!

title: Ebonyi University Management Breaks Silence On Final Year Student Who Committed Suicide
creator: Rachel Okporu Fadoju
description: The management of Ebonyi State University, Abakiliki, has broken its silence on the death of a final-year student of the institution, Favour Ugwuka. Naija News reported that Favour, a student of the Department of English, committed suicide in her hostel at the Ishieke Campus of the university in Abakaliki, the state capital. Favour reportedly passed all her [...]The post Ebonyi University Management Breaks Silence On Final Year Student Who Committed Suicide appeared first on Naija News.
content: The management of Ebonyi State University, Abakiliki, has broken its silence on the death of a final-year student of the institution, Favour Ugwuka. Naija News reported that Favour, a student of the Department of English, committed suicide in her hostel at the Ishieke Campus of the university in Abakaliki, the state capital. Favour reportedly passed all her courses but repeatedly failed a particular course, whose lecturer had vowed she would never pass. The mother of the deceased blamed the lecturer for making her daughter commit suicide. Reacting, the accused lecturer in the Department of English Language, Professor Amechi Enyi, during an interview with journalists in Abakaliki last Friday, revealed that the late student merely copied down three examination questions. The lecturer stated that it was incorrect to claim that her death was related to academic activities. Addressing journalists on Monday at the institution’s conference room, the Vice Chancellor, Professor Chigozie Ogbu, dismissed the deceased’s claims that the accused lecturer was behind her failure. Ogbu stated that the certified true copy of Ugwuka Favour Chinonye’s results, with the registration number EBSU/2018/89726 for the Department of English Language and Literature, was registered in 2018/2019, which is her first year. According to him, Favour offered 9 courses in her first year, out of which she failed 3 and had a CGP of 1.78. In the second semester of her first year, she took 8 courses, out of which she failed 2 and had a CGP of 1.75, thereby having a sessional CGP of 1.76. The Vice Chancellor further revealed Ugwuka’s academic performance in subsequent years, concluding that she had outstanding courses, including ENG 416, which she failed twice. He said, “When a student is confident that a lecturer has deliberately marked them down, and they are sure that they passed the exam, what the student does is to complain to the HOD or Dean and request re-marking, which will be sent to the Vice Chancellor’s office. “It is usually sent to another university to re-mark and let us know. Some of them, on very rare occasions, have returned positive, and whatever the student gets here is usually what they get from the other university after re-marking, and that is the process. “If at the last exam, the late student felt that she was marked down by the lecturer, she would have complained to the Dean and asked for re-marking, and the paper would have been sent to another place for re-marking. ‘But from what is seen, it’s not that the student deserves to pass, and she didn’t pass. And from the record, you will find out that this is not the only course that she didn’t pass. “In 2019/2020, which is her 2nd year, she registered a total of 10 courses. Out of the courses, she was absent in 2 courses: Intermediate English Composition (ENG 215) and Philosophy and Logic (GST 102). She was absent in the 2 courses out of the 8 she wrote, she failed 2. She had a GP of 1.41 in that 1st semester. In her 2nd semester, she registered 10 courses. Out of the 10 courses, she failed 4 and had a CGP of 1.82. Total CGP in her 2nd year is 1.62.”

title: Muggy with a few isolated showers Tuesday
creator: Amanda Holly
description: TAMPA, Fla. (WFLA) -- A weak cold front will approach the area today helping to increase our rain chances ever so slightly. A few isolated showers will be possible north of I-4 late in the morning along with a few showers developing along I-75 and quickly pushing inland through the early afternoon hours. Most of [...]
content: TAMPA, Fla. (WFLA) — A weak cold front will approach the area today helping to increase our rain chances ever so slightly. A few isolated showers will be possible north of I-4 late in the morning along with a few showers developing along I-75 and quickly pushing inland through the early afternoon hours. Most of the rain moves over to the east coast this evening. It will still be warm and very muggy through the day with highs in the low 90s and feels like temperatures close to the triple digits. Although this is a cold front, it is not going to drop our temperatures but it will bring us lower humidity for Wednesday and Thursday. Temperatures will be hotter though with highs in the mid and upper 90s both Wednesday and Thursday. Rain chances will come down back to a 10 and 20% each day through the weekend.

title: 5 Reasons to Buy New Shoes for This School Year
creator: Noor
description: t the start of a new school year, you are standing in front of your closet and thinking about what to wear. As you assess your options, one thing becomes clear – it’s time for a fresh pair of shoes to kick off the school year in style. Whether boys school shoes or girl’s school [...]The post 5 Reasons to Buy New Shoes for This School Year appeared first on TechBullion.
content: Share Tweet Share Share Email t the start of a new school year, you are standing in front of your closet and thinking about what to wear. As you assess your options, one thing becomes clear – it’s time for a fresh pair of shoes to kick off the school year in style. Whether boys school shoes or girl’s school shoes, buying new shoes for the school year offers numerous benefits beyond just fashion. In this article, you will explore five compelling reasons why investing in new shoes for the school year is a smart choice. 1. Outgrown Shoes Your feet can grow quickly, especially during growth spurts. Wearing shoes that are too small can be uncomfortable and even harmful to your feet. Check if your toes feel cramped or if your heels slip out of your shoes when walking. If your shoes feel tight or uncomfortable, it’s time for a new pair that fits properly. Getting shoes that fit ensures your feet have enough room to grow and stay healthy throughout the school year. 2. Increased Activity Levels As the school year starts, you might find yourself getting more active with sports, games, and other activities. Wearing proper shoes is essential to keep up with your increased activity levels. Athletic shoes provide support and cushioning to help prevent injuries and keep you comfortable during physical activities. Look for shoes designed for the specific sports or activities you’ll be participating in. Whether it’s running, basketball, or dancing, having the right shoes can enhance your performance and enjoyment while staying active. 3. Fashion and Self-Expression Your shoes are a way to show off your unique taste and sense of fashion. Whether you prefer sneakers, boots, or loafers, there are endless options to choose from to match your style. Look for shoes in colors or patterns that reflect your personality and make you feel confident. Expressing yourself through your footwear adds a fun and personal touch to your school wardrobe. 4. Durability and Longevity Over time, shoes can wear out and lose their support and cushioning, especially if you wear them every day. Investing in high-quality shoes made from durable materials ensures they last longer and provide better protection for your feet. Look for shoes with sturdy construction and quality materials that can withstand the demands of school life. Choosing durable shoes saves you money in the long run by reducing the need for frequent replacements. 5. Support Local Businesses Local shoe stores provide personalized service and unique selections that you might not find in big chain stores. By shopping locally, you’re helping to support your community and the local economy. Plus, you might discover hidden gems and new favorite brands that you wouldn’t have found otherwise. Prioritize Your Footwear for a Successful School Year As you gear up for the new school year, don’t overlook the importance of prioritizing your footwear. From ensuring proper fit and support to expressing your personal style, the shoes you choose play a significant role in your comfort, confidence, and overall well-being. So, take the time to select footwear that not only feels great but also reflects your unique personality and style. Related Items: Buy New Shoes , School Year Share Tweet Share Share Email Comments

title: Kourtney Kardashian details gruelling IVF journey with husband Travis Barker
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Harry Rutter)
description: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker welcomed their six-month-old son Rocky through a natural pregnancy after five failed IVF cycles
content: Parenthood didn't come easy for Kourtney Kardashian. The reality TV star and her husband Travis Barker welcomed her baby boy Rocky six months ago. She was going through IVF in a desperate bid to become a mother, documenting her struggles on social media and on their show on Disney Plus and Hulu. The Poosh founder has now opened up about the ordeal in more detail, telling followers she went through five failed IVF cycles and three egg retrievals, all before conceiving her son naturally, welcoming their first child together last November. For all the latest on news, politics, sports, and showbiz from the USA, go to The Mirror US . READ MORE: Kourtney Kardashian's rarely seen son Mason, 14, joins Instagram and fans all say the same thing Kourtney detailed having five rounds of IVF ( Image: kourtneykardash/Instagram) She opened up about her pregnancy on social media ( Image: kourtneykardash /Instagram) Answering questions in an Instagram Q&A, one fan had asked Kourtney how to find the "strength to keep going" despite her pregnancy problems. In a candid response, she replied: "I stopped after a year of trying (5 failed IVF cycles, 3 retrievals)." She added: "My body relaxed and I believed in God’s plan for my life. Lots of prayers for whatever was meant to be for us. Also lots of optimizing my health." Kourtney provided more words of wisdom for the follower, who said they'd gone through six rounds of IVF. "I know how hard it is to feel like you're not trying, but believing in God's plan and saying your prayers is so powerful. All the best," she added. Kourtney's pregnancy journey has played out across different seasons of The Kardashians, from start to finish. They mentioned they were trying to conceive during season one, detailing some of the strange ways Kourtney was attempting to get pregnant. In season one, she said her doctor suggested she drink the Blink-182 drummer's semen, four times a week. In December 2022, the pair revealed they were stopping IVF and planned to conceive naturally, with the couple revealing their happy news at a Blink-182 concert in Los Angeles last June – she gave birth after an urgent fetal surgery in September. Rocky joins Kourtney's three kids shared with Scott Disick; Mason, 14, Penelope, 11, and Reign, 9. Travis shares kids Landon, 20, and Alabama, 18, with ex-wife Shanna Moakler. He also helped raise Shanna's daughter, Atiana, 25, from a previous relationship. title: Benching Esteban Ocon after Pierre Gasly run-in risks an even uglier Alpine war
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Daniel Moxon)
description: Esteban Ocon incurred the wrath of Alpine F1 boss Bruno Famin at the Monaco Grand Prix by causing a collision with team-mate Pierre Gasly with a brainless move on the first lap
content: Last May, Esteban Ocon stood on the Monaco Grand Prix podium at the end of one of the very best race weekends of his Formula 1 career. Twelve months on, after Sunday's race in Monte Carlo, his future with Alpine - perhaps in F1 altogether - looks to be in doubt. For more than a year, the threat of civil war at the French team never materialised into anything, but the touchpaper was well and truly lit in Monaco. Only Ocon knows what possessed him as he lunged up the inside of team-mate Pierre Gasly at Portier on the first lap of the race. They made contact which nearly flipped Ocon's car, and sparked a furious tirade from his fellow Frenchman over the radio. He also picked up a time penalty which, because the damage to his own car forced him to retire from the race, was converted instead into a five-place grid drop for the next race in Canada. But it remains to be seen whether he will even be on the Montreal grid. Mercedes 'won't tolerate' F1 star 'attacking' his team-mate as Lewis Hamilton seat ruled out Charles Leclerc made X-rated admission moments after emotional Monaco GP win If Gasly was angry, team principal Bruno Famin was beside himself. He described Ocon's botched overtake as an "attack" on his team-mate and warned that there will be "consequences" for the 27-year-old. It remains to be seen what those consequences will be. Ocon apologised to Famin and Gasly in private and said sorry in public as well, taking full responsibility for his actions - but still it seems to be a real possibility that he could be replaced in Canada. Such a punishment is extremely rare in F1 and Alpine will need to be absolutely sure of themselves before pulling the trigger on such a drastic measure, not least because of the potential legal minefield that it could produce. F1 driver contracts are so complicated these days that it would be daft to assume what clauses do and don't exist in each person's deal. But the team's lawyers will have to comb the fine print and make sure it is legally possible for them to force Ocon to sit out as a punishment. And even if it is, Ocon is not likely to react well to being benched. Tensions are high at Alpine right now and those involved would do well to take a breath and not make any rash decisions in response to this incident, for risk of making things infinitely worse for a team that is already in turmoil. Things may be worse for Ocon in the long-term, though. His Alpine contract is up at the end of the year and, though he is a candidate for the seats at Mercedes and the new Audi F1 project, those prospective new employers aren't likely to be impressed with the sort of driving he demonstrated in Monaco. title: Kirti Vyas murder case: Mumbai court sentences 2 accused to life imprisonment
creator: Mid-day
description: The quantum of sentence of two convicts in the Kirti Vyas murder case was announced on Tuesday.
content: A sessions court in Mumbai on Tuesday sentenced two former staffers of a salon chain to life imprisonment in the 2018 Kirti Vyas murder case. The body of the 28-year-old Kirti Vyas has not been found yet. The quantum of sentence of two convicts in the Kirti Vyas murder case was announced on Tuesday. In the hearing on Monday, the two were found guilty in Kirti Vyas murder case. ADVERTISEMENT Reports stated that Additional Sessions Judge MG Deshpande on Monday had held the convicts--Siddhesh Tamhankar and Khushi Sahjwani, his accomplice--guilty under various sections of the Indian Penal Code including 302 (murder) and 201 (causing disappearance of evidence of offence). Tamhankar and Sahjwani, who worked as account executives and managers at an Andheri salon chain, reported to Vyas, the financial manager, the investigation states. Vyas was allegedly killed after writing a memo to one of the accused about poor performance. Vyas disappeared on March 16, 2018. Her relatives reported her missing to the DB Marg police station after they were unable to locate her using CCTV footage from Grant Road and Mumbai Central railway stations. Vyas was last seen boarding the Virar-bound train at 9:11 am from Grant Road in Andheri, according to the report. According to the PTI report, the Kirti Vyas murder case was later handed to the Crime Branch, which nabbed Tamhankar and Sahjwani. Police solved the case by conducting DNA testing on blood recovered in a car related to one of the defendants and allegedly used in the Kirti Vyas murder case.

title: Typhoon leaves at least seven people dead and thousands displaced in the Philippines
description: A typhoon has finally moved away from the Philippines, leaving at least seven people dead, mostly due to floods or toppled trees
content: A typhoon has finally moved away from the Philippines, leaving at least seven people dead, mostly due to floods or toppled trees, and forcing the closures of several seaports, stranding thousands of passengers, officials said Tuesday. Typhoon Ewiniar crept by the country’s eastern coast late Friday night and lingered over the Philippine islands for several days, before shifting northeastward away from the archipelago. All storm warnings were lifted Tuesday. The typhoon’s shift in direction spared the densely populated capital, Manila, from a potentially damaging hit. Ewiniar, locally known as Aghon, was last tracked Tuesday about 450 kilometers (280 miles) east of the northern town of Basco in Batanes province with sustained winds of 130 kph (81 mph) and gusts of up to 160 kph (99 mph), according to government forecasters. At least six villagers drowned in floodwaters or died after being hit by falling trees during the sudden deluge in the hard-hit province of Quezon, provincial police said. In southern Misamis Oriental province, a villager died when a tree fell and struck a motorcycle taxi she was riding on with her sister as they were on their way to school, police said. Many villages were overwhelmed by flash floods. Some low-lying areas were engulfed in up to eight feet (2.4 meters) of water in Lucena, Quezon province’s capital city. The flooding was partly due to clogged drainage systems after an extra-hot summer season, Quezon Governor Angelina Tan and other provincial officials said. Tan said many houses, including the governor’s residence, were damaged by fierce wind and torrential rains. The typhoon forced her to seek shelter elsewhere while overseeing the distribution of food and other aid to displaced villagers, she said. Before flying to Brunei on Tuesday for a state visit, President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said more than 26,700 people were affected by the typhoon, including many who fled to evacuation centers in five provincial regions. Three airports and 29 seaports could not operate normally due to the typhoon while six cities and towns were hit by power outages, he said. More than 4,800 passengers, truck drivers and cargo helpers were stranded at one point due to seaport closures as the typhoon lashed southern and central provinces, the Philippine coast guard said. “Even before the typhoon hit, we’ve transported relief goods in places near the typhoon’s expected path, so they were all ready,” Marcos said. About 20 typhoons and storms each year batter the Philippine archipelago , which also lies in an Asian region often hit by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions , making it one of the world’s most disaster-prone countries. In 2013, Typhoon Haiyan, one of the strongest on record, left more than 7,300 people dead or missing , flattened entire villages, swept ships inland and displaced more than 5 million in the central Philippines.

title: Scale of Ukrainian Army Losses ‘Astounding’, Western Journalist Admits
description: Last month, the Russian Defense Ministry put the losses of the Ukrainian military since the start of Moscow's special operation at nearly half a million soldiers.
content: “The scale of Ukraine’s losses on the battlefield is astounding,” Irish journalist Chay Bowes has written on his X (formerly Twitter) page. "There's a reason reporting military losses in Ukraine is illegal and access to the front is strictly restricted. Ukraine is lying about the vast death toll. And Western Client media is complying," Bowes added. “The scale of Ukraine's losses on the battlefield is astounding,” according to Irish journalist Chay Bowes. “There's a reason reporting military losses in Ukraine as illegal and access to the front is strictly restricted. Ukriane is lying about the vast death toll. And Western... pic.twitter.com/kMBWHMB7B9 — Sputnik (@SputnikInt) May 28, 2024 The journalist was apparently referring to the Ukrainian president's allegations on the matter in February, when he claimed that the Ukrainian military has ostensibly lost 31,000 soldiers since the beginning of the Russian special military operation in February 2022. In late April, then-Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu said that the Ukrainian Army’s losses stood at almost half a million soldiers at the time. He also said that Russian battlegroups get the better of the enemy along the entire front line, driving Ukrainian troops out of their positions. According to Shoigu, the combat potential of the Russian Army enables it to maintain constant fire on the enemy, preventing them from holding defensive lines. title: Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes visited sex dungeon in quest for martial satisfaction
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Ellie Fry)
description: Former This Morning duo Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford never held back on sharing insight into their busy sex life, and one TV stint saw them visit an underground sex cave to keep the fire burning
content: The 'Richard and Judy' of ITV were notoriously outspoken on screen - and that includes dishing out details about intimacy. Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford sent shockwaves through the showbiz sphere when they announced their separation after 14 years of marriage on Saturday. Eamonn is said to be "angry" about the split, which he allegedly claims was "very much been orchestrated by Ruth" who was "determined" to move on. The duo have reportedly been secretly leading 'separate lives, professional and personally' for two years. Eamonn broke his silence on the sensational split while presenting on GMB this morning, thanking fans for support and cryptically telling viewers 'what a weekend it was' before moving onto discussing the football. Meanwhile, Ruth is taking a break from her Loose Women duties amid the break-up. Eamonn Holmes lets slip struggle with internal turmoil after 'emotional weekend' Friends of the couple claim there are various factors which led to Ruth and Eamonn's marriage falling apart, including Eamonn's reported low moods during his struggles with chronic pain. The star has suffered with crippling health issues for years, and while Ruth has been by his side throughout, caring for him when he struggled with mobility, she previously admitted that Eamonn's injuries had been 'testing' on their marriage. Fractures in their physical spark were seemingly apparent before their public announcement, with the Mail claiming that Eamonn joked to friends about being 'touched' more by his physio than Ruth in recent years. Ruth and Eamonn visited a sex dungeon ( Image: Channel 5) But before their marriage crumbled, the presenting duo were incredibly open about their sizzling sex life, famously treating viewers to cheeky innuendos whenever they had the chance. They even hosted Eamonn & Ruth's 7 Year Itch in 2017 - a show dedicated to injecting spice back into a marriage. And it wasn't for the faint of heart. The mini series saw Ruth and Eamonn visit a sex dungeon - complete with sex swings, a latex-clad dominatrix and whips - in a bid to inspire couples in the bedroom. The Beflast-born presenter got stuck right in as he brandished a whip, surrounded by scary-looking contraptions. He also admired a blow-up sex doll on the show. A woman called Mistress Komakino joined the presenting duo in the underground sex cave to teach them how she helps couples find their spark again. Eamonn told the Mistress to spank a man in a leather bondage mask, but Ruth wasn't so keen as she winced: "Oh I don't like hurting people!" Eamonn got stuck in with the toys ( Image: Channel 5) But Ruth has previously revealed what makes her tick. Just months before their split, she revealed the one thing Eamonn would do to ensure he got sex. She told her fellow Loose Women panelists: "You can have all the compliments and the flowers but then, if Eamonn comes home and has used my car and he goes, 'Filled the petrol up and did your water bottle', I'm like, 'Get upstairs right now'." As the studio audience burst into fits of laughter, Ruth continued: "I hate doing it. Literally, I'll go round with my petrol light on red, the water bottle empty, smeared [windscreen], I'm like, 'Oh I can't stop and do that,' so he'll do it for me and he knows, he knows." She added with a smirk: "Everyone's got their little trick." Meanwhile, Eamonn once joked about their active sex life, revealing: "I love Ruth deeply but also I fancy her. How could I resist? No wonder I look tired all the time - that woman has me run ragged. I go to work for a break." And Ruth revealed her husband's unwavering obsession with her figure helped fan the fames in the bedroom. "Eamonn is my biggest fan and always makes me feel really sexy," she once told The Mirror . "When I think I'm at my slimmest he thinks I'm too thin. He likes me curvy - he loves boobs, bottoms and legs. I'm really lucky because it would be awful to have a man who commented on me piling on the pounds." Dunelm's 'most comfortable' hanging egg chair is 'perfect for British weather'

title: Greenlit city centre office building to become Artificial Intelligence hub
creator: Shannon Mower
description: An office building set to be built in Doncaster will become a “flagship digital tech hub”, the council has announced.
content: On Thursday (23 May) Doncaster Council revealed the details of Gateway One, an office and retail building that was greenlit by the planning committee in January. The site will revolve around digital technology, with hopes to allow Doncaster to progress as a centre of excellence for Artificial Intelligence . Advertisement Advertisement Did you know with an ad-lite subscription to Doncaster Free Press, you get 70% fewer ads while viewing the news that matters to you. Local AI firm Automatic Analytics will become a founder member of the project, with several other businesses expected to take residence in the building. According to the council, the site’s design will “enable businesses and entrepreneurs to co-locate with other likeminded businesses and industry leaders to collaborate, develop local supply chain opportunities, access local, regional, and national business support provision, and strengthen industry links with education and skills provision.” The £24 million building will be funded by the Town Deal which was granted to the council by central government. Town Deal funding in Doncaster has been earmarked for the council’s Urban Masterplan, which aims to regenerate the city. Advertisement Advertisement Located on Trafford Way, the building will contribute to the transformation of the Gateway area. Trafford Court Offices, Wolseley Plumb Centre and a vacant retail unit will all be demolished to make way for the new site. Office space will span across five floors, with two commercial units on the ground floor which incorporate alfresco dining. An area of public open space will also be incorporated into the scheme, with the site being designed to achieve Net Zero carbon emissions. Advertisement Advertisement Mayor of Doncaster, Ros Jones , said: “Our city is rapidly becoming recognised for its industry expertise around Artificial Intelligence, and I am keen to build this momentum and drive forward our ambition to regenerate our city centre and develop our economy for the 21st century. “This is an exciting time for Doncaster city centre, with work taking place across several key areas and I look forward to seeing businesses across the city and region take advantage of this state-of-the-art facility.” Work is expected to start on the site in early 2025, with completion expected in 2026.

title: Verstappen: 2024 was never going to be like last year
creator: Jad Mallak
description: GRANDPRIX247.comIn-Depth & Independent Formula 1 News All The TimeMax Verstappen insisted following a tough Monaco Grand Prix for Red Bull that he was always aware that the 2024 Formula 1 season was never going to be like his exceptional 2023 campaign. Red Bull have been struggling in the past three F1 races – Miami, Imola, and Monaco – to recreate their dominant form which they have enjoyed since 2022. In 2023 Verstappen and Red Bull had an unprecedented run, the team winning all but one of the 22 [...]The post Verstappen: 2024 was never going to be like last year appeared first on GRANDPRIX247.com.
content: Max Verstappen insisted following a tough for Red Bull that he was always aware that the 2024 season was never going to be like his exceptional 2023 campaign. Red Bull have been struggling in the past three F1 races – Miami, Imola, and Monaco – to recreate their dominant form which they have enjoyed since 2022. In 2023 Verstappen and Red Bull had an unprecedented run, the team winning all but one of the 22 races – Carlos Sainz won in Singapore – while the Dutchman took 19 wins out of his team’s 21. But 2024 has been a far cry from its predecessor, as despite still leading both Championships, that has not come easily for Verstappen and Red Bull as the like of McLaren and Ferrari are pushing them hard, with the RB20 seemingly more vulnerable than its older sibling the all conquering RB19. Red Bull boss Christian Horner has repeatedly pointed out that the car designs were going to confirm with the cars’ pace converging as well, and now Verstappen added that 2023 was an exception. Speaking to the media after the Monaco GP, the reigning F1 Champion said: “It [2024] was never going to be like last year, to have a season like that is quite rare. “I always knew that this year was going to be a little bit different but also I don’t really think about championship positions or whatever with so many races left. Some races are a bit better for us and some are a bit worse for us. At the end of the day it all works out. “The cars are much closer, some cars work better on street circuits and some work better in fast corners rather than low speed corners. It will swing a bit,” he pointed out. The RB20 doesn’t like kerbs and bumps Asked about the weakness of his RB20, Verstappen said: “Any track that is bumpy or has kerbs, or you have to ride a lot of kerbs, so the street circuits will probably be a little bit tricky but hopefully by then we have a little bit of understanding of what is going on. “We have to wait and see,” he continued when asked about the kerbs in Canada, “new surface as well I think, that might also give us some surprises but it is probably also not going to be our strongest weekend because of that but probably a little bit better than here.” The triple F1 Champion insisted Red Bull racing are resting on their laurels, he said: “We take everything very seriously but sometimes things are not very easy to fix but we are working flat-out on it. “First we need to understand what it is, we don’t now a the moment so this is something that we have to find first,” Verstappen concluded when asked how fast the issue can be fixed. Verstappen currently leads the F1 Drivers’ Standings by 31 points from Ferrari’s Charles Leclerc.

The role at Pirelli Stadium was the 37-year-old former Swansea City, Barnsley and Inter Miami assistant manager's first job in charge of a senior side. Whoever the new man is, he’s going to have his work cut out. Thoughts? Stockport County , MK Dons and Bristol Rovers are interested in free agent defender Clark Robertson, according to the Daily Record The centre-back could be set for a return to England this summer following a spell in Israel at F.C. Ashdod. He helped them finish in 6th position in the Israeli Premier League last season. Gillingham are keen on a move for Accrington Stanley winger Jack Nolan, according to reporter Pete O’Rourke on X . Salford have announced two more friendlies. They will face Warrington Town on 24th July and Rochdale on Saturday 3rd August. Appere will join Stevenage when his contract at Sixfields runs out next month. The 6ft 1in Scot has scored 18 goals in 106 games for the Cobblers, including nine when they were promoted to League One in 2022-23. Louis Appere joins from Northampton “It’s been in the works for a while. I’m really looking forward to getting started. “I had positive chats with the manager and it’s a club with real potential with the project and the plans that he has got in place. “The run the club went on towards the end of last season made everyone pay attention. It’s a good club with a good manager and I’m hoping we can do good things.” League Two champs Stockport County have a new man. Jay Mingi has joined from Colchester. Platt, 26, moves to Meadow Lane on a free transfer following two years with the Bantams. He moved to Valley Parade after three years at Barrow, who he helped win promotion back to the Football League Two in 2020. "Jay had a fantastic back end of the League Two season at Colchester," "He showed his versatility and intelligence, switching from a familiar central midfield role to wide centre-back, right-back and right wing-back at times. “We believe he has real potential to develop, whilst immediately having the physical characteristics of being on the front foot, aggressive and quick, which will allow him to flourish in League One."

title: Fired domestic worker turns to crime, steals from former employer and neighbours
creator: Cynthia Goba
description: Nyanga man sentenced for serial thefts from former employer, neighbours In a troubling case that has left a community on edge, a 28-year-old Nyanga man has been brought before the Nyanga Magistrates’ Court, facing three counts of theft. The suspect, who was previously employed as a domestic worker, has been accused of targeting his former [...]The post Fired domestic worker turns to crime, steals from former employer and neighbours first appeared on My Zimbabwe News.
content: Nyanga man sentenced for serial thefts from former employer, neighbours In a troubling case that has left a community on edge, a 28-year-old Nyanga man has been brought before the Nyanga Magistrates’ Court, facing three counts of theft. The suspect, who was previously employed as a domestic worker, has been accused of targeting his former employer and two other local residents. According to the National Prosecuting Authority of Zimbabwe, the accused was fired from his position on April 12th, 2024. The very next day, he allegedly returned to the complainant’s home while she was away at a funeral and stole a host of items, including three buckets of yams, three buckets of maize, and a bed cover. The suspect is also accused of stealing five chickens from the complainant’s fowl run. Upon the complainant’s return, she discovered that her doors had been left open, and the missing property was nowhere to be found. It was later reported that the accused had been seen selling the stolen goods. The suspect’s criminal activities did not end there. On April 29th and 30th, he is said to have dug up potatoes from the fields of two additional complainants, valued at a total of $96 USD. Thorough investigations by the authorities led to the recovery of five bags of the stolen potatoes and the eventual arrest of the suspect. The court found the accused guilty on all three counts of theft and sentenced him to a total of seven months in prison. Three months of the sentence were suspended, and an additional month was suspended on the condition of restitution. The remaining three months were further suspended, provided the suspect completes 105 hours of community service.

title: Belgium announce Euro 2024 squad with huge star OUT as fans say ‘golden generation turned bronze’
creator: Gary Stonehouse
content: THIBAUT COURTOIS has been left out of the Belgium Euro 2024 squad as fans claimed that their “golden generation turned bronze”. The Real Madrid goalkeeper, 32, has been capped 102 times for his country. But he will not be adding to that total this summer in Germany as he was the big-name omission from the squad. Courtois missed nearly the entire season due to a knee ligament injury. He then needed another operation on his knee in March when he had a setback but he did return to play four games earlier this month for LaLiga champions Madrid. Courtois threw his Belgium future into doubt after branding manager Domenico Tedesco a liar. He and his international gaffer had been at loggerheads after he was snubbed of the captaincy for their matches against Austria and Estonia last June following Eden Hazard's retirement. Courtois staggeringly accused both the Belgian Football Federation and Tedesco of not appreciating him. Then there was further controversy last month as Tedesco claimed that he had done everything in his power to ensure the crocked Courtois plays for the Red Devils again. But the former Chelsea stopper publicly took umbrage to that claim by responding to a post with his comments with three Pinocchio emojis. CASINO SPECIAL - BEST CASINO WELCOME OFFERS Courtois made his Belgium debut in 2011 aged 19 and has gone on to make a further 101 appearances for his country. But he had confirmed way back in December that he would not be fit enough to represent his country in Germany. Meanwhile, the likes of Manchester City’s Kevin de Bruyne and Jeremy Doku are both in, along with ex-Premier League striker Romelu Lukaku and Arsenal winger Leandro Trossard. But the Courtois news was not the only shock as Tedesco announced his 25-man squad. Belgium also recalled Axel Witsel - that is despite the 35-year-old announcing his international retirement last year. Tedesco personally visited the Atletico Madrid defender to try and persuade him to return, and his words have done the trick. Witsel earned the last of his 130 caps at the World Cup in Qatar, where Belgium were eliminated in the group stage. Meanwhile, the country’s most-capped player Jan Vertonghen has also been named at the age of 36. Here is the 25-man squad for Euro 2024 in full: Goalkeepers: Koen Casteels (VfL Wolfsburg), Thomas Kaminski (Luton Town), Matz Sels (Nottingham Forest) Defenders: Timothy Castagne (Fulham), Maxim De Cuyper (Club Brugge), Zeno Debast (Anderlecht), Wout Faes (Leicester City), Thomas Meunier (Trabzonspor), Jan Vertonghen (Anderlecht), Arthur Theate (Stade Rennais), Axel Witsel (Atletico Madrid) Midfielders: Yannick Carrasco (Al Shabab), Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City), Orel Mangala (Olympique Lyonnais), Amadou Onana (Everton), Youri Tielemans (Aston Villa), Arthur Vermeeren (Atletico Madrid), Aster Vranckx (vfL Wolfsburg) Forwards: Johan Bakayoko (PSV Eindhoven), Charles De Ketelaere (Atalanta), Jeremy Doku (Manchester City), Romelu Lukaku (Roma), Dodi Lukebakio (Sevilla), Lois Openda (RB Leipzig), Leandro Trossard (Arsenal). However, another notable absentee is Fenerbahce's Michy Batshuayi. The former Chelsea and Crystal Palace forward, 30, has scored 27 goals in 55 caps. Belgium have under-achieved and failed to claim any silverware for the past decade after having a squad many had dubbed as the ‘Golden Generation’. And upon seeing the squad announcement for this upcoming tournament, one fan commented: “Golden generation turned bronze...” Another said: “They are not seeing the quarter finals.” “Belgium fell off,” said a third before a fourth added: “They're just perfect for group stages exit. It's just a matter of time.” STAY in the know this summer with The Sun's transfer experts. Chelsea have been given permission from Leicester to speak to Enzo Maresca . Liverpool and Chelsea are eyeing a summer move for Crysencio Summerville. Premier League clubs are targeting Tosin Adarabioyo, who will be a free agent when his Fulham contract expires next month. Follow our LIVE TRANSFER BLOG for all the latest deals, gossip and exclusives.
